par.text: Manganese is a silvery-white, hard and brittle metal.

It oxidises superficially in air. It reacts with acids; when heated it also reacts with certain non-metals, such as sulphur, carbon and nitrogen. Manganese was discovered in 1774 by the Swedish chemist Karl Wilhelm Scheele and isolated the same year by Johann Gottlieb Gahn. Manganese compounds are poisonous.
